data.description:
Catalog instances of violence at protests and riots for left-wing causes. Previously laughed off as a non-threat, ideas that were once far-flung extremes are now mainstream, and people are fighting and dying over them. It's time to sober up, and wipe the stupid grin off our faces before we die smiling. 

*Post any instance of left wing violence with a the date it occurred and as much information as possible.*

Tangentially acceptable posts: 
* Left wingers openly endorsing violence
* Violence happening in cities currently over-run by demonstrators.
data.description_html:
Catalog instances of violence at protests and riots for left-wing causes. Previously laughed off as a non-threat, ideas that were once far-flung extremes are now mainstream, and people are fighting and dying over them. It's time to sober up, and wipe the stupid grin off our faces before we die smiling.

Post any instance of left wing violence with a the date it occurred and as much information as possible.

Tangentially acceptable posts:

  • Violence happening in cities currently over-run by demonstrators.

data.description:
A guild all about the United States of America, also known as United States or the USA. Post news, memes and discussion about the US of A here!

There are only 4 rules here:
- No NSFW posts.
- **No posts made by bots.**
- Posts must relate to part, or all, of the United States of America in some way.
- Follow the Ruqqus TOS.

data.description:
A Free Speech Guild With a Focus on Memes. 

This is an extension of FunnyMemeSpot operations we have a discord https://discord.gg/PwrD8hz, we also have a YouTube channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5sR6_tQgc3C8n93bYqQWzw, we have a Twitter @FunnyMemeSpot_ https://twitter.com/FunnyMemeSpot_, we also have an Instagram, https://www.instagram.com/funnymemespot_/

This place follows the typical FunnyMemeSpot rules: 

Rule 1: No Porn or Gore, this includes nudity, and pretty much anything nasty to look at 

Rule 2: There must be an attempt at Humor, you can be offensive here but there has to be an attempt at humor. You can cover pretty much any topic you want but you have to at least try to make some sort of humor of it. If something is removed based on this rule you will have to convince the guild masters that there is an attempt at humor. 

Rule 3: No posting more than 10 times a day
data.description_html:
A Free Speech Guild With a Focus on Memes.

This is an extension of FunnyMemeSpot operations we have a discord https://discord.gg/PwrD8hz, we also have a YouTube channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5sR6_tQgc3C8n93bYqQWzw, we have a Twitter @FunnyMemeSpot_ https://twitter.com/FunnyMemeSpot_, we also have an Instagram, https://www.instagram.com/funnymemespot_/

This place follows the typical FunnyMemeSpot rules:

Rule 1: No Porn or Gore, this includes nudity, and pretty much anything nasty to look at

Rule 2: There must be an attempt at Humor, you can be offensive here but there has to be an attempt at humor. You can cover pretty much any topic you want but you have to at least try to make some sort of humor of it. If something is removed based on this rule you will have to convince the guild masters that there is an attempt at humor.

Rule 3: No posting more than 10 times a day

data.description:
Here we post playlists of online lectures. 
Absorb and discuss what you've learned here. 
Time stamps, questions, and comments on the videos are most welcome.

Rules:

1. To ensure lectures are easy to find please stick to the guild formatting of: 
 **[YearOfLecture] [Subject] LectureTitle - Course# University/SourceOfLecture (LecturerName) - [AcademicLevel (High School, Undergraduate, Graduate)]**

2. **Keep conversations civil.** Debate is good but don't attack/name call others

3. Don't post just one video (unless it's just a one-shot lecture) but instead **post the whole playlist if the link is available.**

Formatting example:

[2001] [Art] Underwater Basketweaving - UW 101 Yale (Erick McGargles) - [Undergraduate Level] 

**Undefined information is fine, just post the available info in the Title.**

Looking for high-quality non-political Guilds? See +GuildsOfSubstance, a growing list of worthwhile Ruqqus non-political Guilds.
data.description_html:
Here we post playlists of online lectures. Absorb and discuss what you've learned here. Time stamps, questions, and comments on the videos are most welcome.

Rules:

  1. To ensure lectures are easy to find please stick to the guild formatting of: [YearOfLecture] [Subject] LectureTitle - Course# University/SourceOfLecture (LecturerName) - [AcademicLevel (High School, Undergraduate, Graduate)]

  2. Keep conversations civil. Debate is good but don't attack/name call others

  3. Don't post just one video (unless it's just a one-shot lecture) but instead post the whole playlist if the link is available.

Formatting example:

[2001] [Art] Underwater Basketweaving - UW 101 Yale (Erick McGargles) - [Undergraduate Level]

Undefined information is fine, just post the available info in the Title.

Looking for high-quality non-political Guilds? See +GuildsOfSubstance, a growing list of worthwhile Ruqqus non-political Guilds.
